txt.en: 'That is not the death of a king of Rohan.'
'Not many, no... but this choice I do have.'
'Eorlingas!'
Stand with Théoden
Talk to Háma
'Riders, make ready!'
'We will ride forth, and bring glorious battle to the Orcs!'
'Háma...'
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
'Go, my doorward.'
'Mount your steed, [placeholder].'
'You ride with us!'

'How fares the battle down below, [placeholder]? There has been hard fighting up here, and Théoden King has bloodied his sword already. So far we have turned aside all our foes, but I fear they will storm the lower levels and we will be surrounded. \n\n'Do you have any good tidings for the king, or has all been lost? This night seems never-ending, and that is a trait it shares with the forces of Isengard!'
Aragorn refuses to give in to despair. He intends to defend the Hornburg even as the Orcs threaten to overrun the fortress.
In the hours before dawn, the forces of Saruman show no sign of relenting. The defenders have retreated into the Hornburg, uncertain of their ability to long survive against the forces of Isengard.

'My sword rests no longer in idleness! I am prepared to fight and die for my land and my people! It should have been so earlier, but for the honeyed words of Saruman, poured into my ear by his servant Gríma.\n\n'But no longer! My place is here, in defence of my people until the very end. It will not be much longer.'
King Théoden has slain a mighty war-troll, but the beast carried a black powder bomb with a lit fuse!
DNT - Blah!

'If the Hornburg falls, there will be none left to safe-guard the kingdom of Rohan. We must defend the fortress for as long as we can!\n\n'There is no other choice left to us, [placeholder]. It falls to us to save Rohan!'
'That was quickly-done, [placeholder]. You may have purchased us a reprieve, and saved the fortress from another of Saruman's sorcerous devices!\n\n'We are safe, for now.'
Fight alongside Aragorn in defence of the Hornburg
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
'We will ride from the Hornburg and bring death to the Orcs! Riders, to me! Let none fear to ride with us, for the bards will sing of our deeds long after we are gone!\n\n'This is the hour of Rohan!'
Stand with Háma and Théoden
Théoden leads a charge of his riders down the causeway into the waiting Orcs, and he has requested that you ride with him.
Háma, the door-ward of Théoden, stands before the Hornburg. He braces himself for news of the battle.
Listen to Aragorn and Théoden and decide what can be done
Mount your travelling steed and talk to Théoden
Théoden stands atop the fortress, surveying his seemingly insurmountable foes.
Ride with Théoden down the causeway into the waiting Orcs
'This way.'
'My King!'
'Stand not so near to the edge!'
'I fear the arrows of the Orcs might find you!'
The fuse on the black powder bomb has been quenched, and the immediate danger has been avoided. Aragorn wishes to speak with you.
'For Rohan!'
'What is that?'
The defenders have thrown back another of Saruman's assaults, but ten thousand Orcs remain outside the walls. Aragorn and Théoden must decide if anything can be done.
'The Orcs have almost overrun the north-west wall.'
'This troll met his end at your hand, Théoden King.'
'It is not so, not yet!'
'I will give you the time you need, my king.'
'[placeholder]!'
'No foe shall pass, my king!'
'I will stand guard by your door one last time.'
'Follow me.'
'That is not the last of them, [placeholder]!'
'Black powder! [placeholder]! Quench the fuse!'
'We slew these Orcs. So too will we slay the next.'
Théoden has asked you to join his riders on their assault from the Hornburg.\n\n<rgb=#00FF00>Mount your travelling steed and speak to Théoden.</rgb>
'We should get out of the open, Théoden.'
'This way, [placeholder].'
The Hornburg has been overrun, and Rohan will fall!
'You need not fuss over me, Háma.'
'I do not fear death.'
'I do not think we will see another sunrise, [placeholder].'
'Then it is over!'
'For Rohan!'
'Now this is a king's foe!'
'Your death is upon you, beast!'
Talk to Théoden
'Know that it was Théoden, son of Thengel, who dealt the killing blow!'
'Safe?'
Talk to Aragorn
Quench the fuse on the black powder bomb
Talk to Aragorn
'There are not many choices left to you, Théoden.'
'You speak of safety when ten thousand Orcs clamour outside these walls?'
Storied Tale: The Hornburg
'Théoden, it will take time for your men to prepare.'
'Aye, Háma.'
'But how many more will need ending before I reach my own?'
'I will not cower within these walls until the end, Aragorn.'
